title: Open Strings and Heterotic Instantons
authors:
Rafael \'Alvarez-Garc\'ia, Christian Knei{\ss}l, Jacob M. Leedom,
  Nicole Righi
abstract:
Motivated by closed string perturbation theory arguments by S. Shenker, we
consider non-perturbative effects of characteristic strength
$\mathcal{O}(e^{-1/g_{s}})$, with $g_{s}$ the closed string coupling constant,
in supersymmetric critical heterotic string theories. We argue that in 10D such
effects arise from heterotic "D-instantons," i.e. heterotic disk diagrams,
whose existence relies on a non-trivial interplay between worldsheet and
spacetime degrees of freedom. In compactifications of the
$\mathrm{SemiSpin}(32)$ heterotic string, we argue that similar effects can
arise from wrapped Euclidean non-BPS "D-strings." Two general principles arise:
The first is that the consistency of those heterotic branes on which the
fundamental string can end relies on an inflow mechanism for spacetime degrees
of freedom. The second is that Shenker's argument, taken to its logical
conclusion, implies that all closed string theories must exhibit open strings
as well.
